body: Just 10 iterations over fitting?Please give me some suggestions.

Reduce your classification loss gain here:

https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/609a9d94cf7c6fea4ef420e71dd9fc1ff540e40f/train.py#L26

ah,thank your quick  reply. I seem to understand something, How much reduction of classification loss gain is appropriateï¼Ÿ
@Broad-sky that's up to you per your situation.

@glenn-jocher 
I used the following command: 
python3 train.py --data data/my.data --img-size 512--epochs 1 --batch-size 64 --accumulate 1 --evolve

The evolve result is obtained, However, after training nearly 40 epochs, there is still a higher Val classification phenomenon. At the same time, Val obj began to diverge. What should I do next to train the model? I look forward to your reply.

Thank you

@Broad-sky hyperparameter evolution is a seperate topic, see https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/issues/392. This requires hundreds of evolved generations to produce optimal hyperparameters on your dataset.

The rough rule of thumb is that all of your loss components should contribute proportionally to their share of the output solution, so if you believe that obj, box and cls are all equally important outputs, they should produce roughly equal losses at the start of training. Adjust your cls accordingly.

Is the hyperparameter to get the training result quickly?Can we not use hyperparameters? I look forward to your  reply.
thank you
@Broad-sky I don't understand your question. The hyperparameters are tuned for best mAP on COCO after 273 epochs.

@glenn-jocher How to determine the initial value of the hyperparameter when training my own dataset?
thank you
@Broad-sky use the default values in train.py

![results](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/46519564/71648573-2bd93200-2d41-11ea-8da4-8ad5eaece1af.png

Default parameter used, val classification and val objectness is diverged

@glenn-jocher Thank you for your response to this issue. I trained the network on my own dataset twice:
- The first run: cls=37.4
-The second run: cls= 10

In both cases, the val classification loss starts to diverge after 10 epoch. It seems your solution can not solve the problem. any other suggestion?
